update.description:
This is a first pass at Mud. It works by defining a model with a contact sensor and the plugin. The model should have a collision shape with collide_without_contact set to true. The plugin uses the contact sensor to detect objects and creates dynamic joints with tunable stiffness and damping.

This pull request includes some changes to ODE that allow changes to the erp and cfm values for the constrained directions of joints. This is necessary to tune the stiffness and damping.

There is an example world: sdf/worlds/mud.world

Currently the mud can only act on one link at a time. It may also act on the ground plane if placed in contact with the ground. There is room for improvement.

UPDATE:
I've added the ability to for mud to act on multiple links, but the scoped link names must be specified as sdf parameters to the plugin (see mud.world for an example).

Merged with default, fixed a bug in my ODE changes that I found while testing with Atlas.
update.title: Mud Plugin

content.raw: I merged from default and ran make test and the tests pass. I'm going to merge.
content.html: I merged from default and ran make test and the tests pass. I'm going to merge.

content.raw:
I noticed that as well. It appears to be a regression of issue #236, which I thought had been fixed. I updated Sensor_TEST.cc in ffd9585 (branch issue_236_regression) to illustrate the regression and re-opened #236.

It happens because sometimes sensors fail to publish messages for a period of time after world reset. For example, if you Reset World after 10 seconds of simulation, it may take 10 seconds for the sensors to start publishing. See #236 for details.
content.html:
I noticed that as well. It appears to be a regression of issue #236, which I thought had been fixed. I updated Sensor_TEST.cc in ffd9585 (branch issue_236_regression) to illustrate the regression and re-opened #236.

It happens because sometimes sensors fail to publish messages for a period of time after world reset. For example, if you Reset World after 10 seconds of simulation, it may take 10 seconds for the sensors to start publishing. See #236 for details.

content.raw: Nice! One thing I noticed, reset world sometimes seems to remove the mud effect from the model
content.html: Nice! One thing I noticed, reset world sometimes seems to remove the mud effect from the model

content.html: I just noticed that this flag is not used; it was leftover from a previous implementation. I'll take it out.
